title: Shopify GitHub Login and Password exposed all private source code might be available.

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
Sello (com.shopify.Sello)
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/sello/id947038847?mt=8

ios Mobile Application

Versions 1.0.1, 1.1, 1.1.2, 1.1.3, 1.2, 

Podfile left inside application exposes GitHub Password for Shopify.

username: shopify-dep
password: 1910c92631a81a4c41dafbf96d537e3f24506b11


Impact: Access to all source code of all programs Shopify makes, which would not be good :)

source of file:


source "https://github.com/CocoaPods/Specs.git"
platform :ios, "8.0"

# ignore all warnings from all pods
inhibit_all_warnings!

target "Sello" do
  pod "SHPShareKit", git: "https://shopify-dep:1910c92631a81a4c41dafbf96d537e3f24506b11@github.com/Shopify/ios-share-kit"
  pod "HockeySDK"
  pod "Reachability", "~> 3.2"
  pod "PureLayout", "~> 2.0.6"
  pod "pop", "~> 1.0"
  pod "Intercom"
  pod "GoogleAnalytics"
  pod "Mixpanel"
  pod "Branch"
end

target "SelloTests", exclusive: true do
  pod "OCMock", "3.1.2"
end



Sello Also Exposes a series of other private credentials.


ApnsApplication:SELLO_IOS
branch_key:key_live_cgmRq1Cqi0GTaTZt6ugtkghaCwjEkH8N
FacebookAppID:825102250879029
FacebookDisplayName:Sello
GoogleAnalyticsID:UA-49226624-4
GooglePlusClientID:833666260708-pd79q7hfldjboqnsdkjep0c09lbusg8s.apps.googleusercontent.com
HockeyAppID:e220ee56ef6c7c0f9313dec065ab14d4
IntercomApiKey:ios_sdk-6c8980b1b197f9a4b741d8a99ea30eeb5eb7447c
IntercomAppID:ztfy5avc
MixpanelToken:b076cfff7bf5a6b04bb332efb07d339e
MixpanelTokenDev:d2c21feef224fbb03b48e1e1acc3d0f5
ShopifyAppHost:https://app.shopify.com/


Please let me know how I can help with more details, good luck on your side of the screen :)

-Eric

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Our team is busy triaging and fixing HackerOne reports, and it may take us up to 1 week (or more) to triage any given issue. Don't worry, we'll get to yours!

While you are waiting, you can read over our list of non applicable issues listed on our program page: https://hackerone.com/shopify. Make sure your issue isn't listed!
Thank you for your report. We revoked the password earlier this evening and we're continuing to investigate the issue.

Thanks for the quick response :)  This is my first test bug submitted to Shopify, looking forward to looking deeper to help find issues to better secure all of Shopify's products :)  Wish you well on your side of the screen

Thanks again for your report. As I mentioned earlier, the GitHub password (which gave read-only access to our private repositories) was revoked shortly after your report. The other values you quoted are identifiers that the application uses to identify itself to third-party services. They are not intended to be secret.

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we will be in touch with you again soon.

Thanks Kindly,

The mixpanel tokens have an api to add users and send email to existing users via the api, just a heads up for users sending spam or alternate messages (your account has problems please visit http://www.badguys.com/  to reset your password etc.



You can only send emails to users whose profiles have the special $email property. The value of this property should be the email address of the user as a string - something like "joe.doe@example.com". To set this property with the JavaScript library, you can make a call to mixpanel.people.set:

mixpanel.people.set({
    $email: "joe.doe@example.com"
});


example interactions with your api keys that can be modified potentially to do no so nice things.

curl https://mixpanel.com/api/1.0/custom-query \
    -u b076cfff7bf5a6b04bb332efb07d339e: \
    --data-urlencode params='{"from_date":"2016-01-01", "to_date": "2016-01-07"}' \
    --data-urlencode script='function main(){ return Events(params).groupBy(["name"], mixpanel.reducer.count()) }'



curl https://mixpanel.com/api/1.0/custom-query \
    -u d2c21feef224fbb03b48e1e1acc3d0f5: \
    --data-urlencode params='{"from_date":"2016-01-01", "to_date": "2016-01-07"}' \
    --data-urlencode script='function main(){ return Events(params).groupBy(["name"], mixpanel.reducer.count()) }'

It appears that the API can only be used to add email addresses, not to send messages to them. The token is meant to be included in client-side Javascript code of web pages, and so the actions that can be performed with it are intended to be safe.
cool beans :)  Thanks for checking into it on your side, I'll stop with the messages and get back to looking for some more issues, good luck on your side of the screen :)

This is awesome thanks so very much, it helps out myself and helps me to support my family which has grown with our first child and happy healthy 11 month old girl :)

Will look deeper into the apps to see how I can help make them more secure for Shopify :)

Wish you and yours well on your side of the screen :)

summaries.content:
Well this was from when I was young in my bug hunting adventure about 15 months back.

Time to start releasing my reports to help others :)

May you be well on your side of the screen,

-Eric

user.name: Eric
user.bio: May we find peace in these challenging times :)  Thank you for your love for yourself and others in all the ways you      express it :)
